column4: my ubuntu takes about 55s to reach my desktop after power on, is that normal? seems a bit slow
to reach your desktop, or to reach the display manager (GUI login manager) ?
to reach my desktop, after i log in.
from display manager to KDE/Gnome ?
KDE can be a bit slow to log in, Gnome is faster, and anything else is lightning quick
50 seconds for Gnome seems abnormally slow to me
its 55s from power on until gnome is completely loaded
what could be slowing me down??
well how long until the DM comes up ?
also, how much RAM do you have and what type of CPU ?
dualcore pentium M 1.8. 1gig rame
dualcore pentium M 1.8. 1gig rame
dualcore pentium M 1.8. 1gig rame
dualcore pentium M 1.8. 1gig rame
any idea?

well, 50 seconds to the desktop from power on with a full BIOS RAM check and so on is about normal, but if it is taking more than 10 seconds from the time you press Enter on your password until you're able to use the Gnome desktop, that is not right
just type in "runlevel" and it will tell you which you're in, as well as the one you were previously in, if you switched
that looks like a problem with your "TERM" setting
what do you mean? what could the problem be
you pasted a bunch of gibberish, I figured you meant that is what showed up on your screen
now N 2 showed up, what does that mean?
your default runlevel is in the top of /etc/inittab
that was for you, forgot to use your nickname
